definitions.definition: A telescopic binary star , visually the brightest star in the night sky, a part of the northern constellation of Canis Major (the Greater Dog), one of three stars in the Winter Triangle asterism . Long understood as a single extremely luminous white star, it was associated in ancient Egypt with the Nile flood and in Greek and Roman culture with the " dog days " of summer .
The brightest star of the aforementioned star system; the white main-sequence star Sirius A.

main_definition: ( astronomy ) A telescopic binary star , visually the brightest star in the night sky, a part of the northern constellation of Canis Major (the Greater Dog), one of three stars in the Winter Triangle asterism . Long understood as a single extremely luminous white star, it was associated in ancient Egypt with the Nile flood and in Greek and Roman culture with the " dog days " of summer .
secondary_definitions: ( astronomy , specifically ) The brightest star of the aforementioned star system; the white main-sequence star Sirius A.
